newsitem.title: UK: Cadbury confident of progress despite stg.
newsitem.headline: Cadbury confident of progress despite stg.

text.p: British food and drinks groups Cadbury Schweppes Plc said on Thursday it was confident the group would show further progress in 1997, despite seeing some adverse impact from the strength of sterling.

"In common with other UK companies with significant overseas earnings, we are seeing some adverse impact on our results from the strength of the pound," chairman Dominic Cadbury told the annual meeting.
"Nevertheless, we are confident that, before disposal gains, the Group will show further progress in 1997".

He said the group's beverage operations were performing well so far in 1997 but its confectionery markets had experienced a slow start to the year, although market share was "holding up well or increasing".
